elements.title: campus of the College of William & Mary (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that lovers on the campus of the College of William & Mary are encouraged to cross the Crim Dell bridge (pictured) together?

elements.title: Mike "Hitman" Wilson (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that after Shawn Christopher's "Another Sleepless Night" was rereleased with Mike "Hitman" Wilson's name removed, it charted 24 places higher on the UK Singles Chart?

elements.title: Crassispira incrassata (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... it has been suggested that Crassispira incrassata may be a southern variation of Crassispira bottae and not its own species?

elements.title: Maria Olovennikova (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Maria Olovennikova was the only woman present at the founding conference of Narodnaya Volya?

elements.title: Pipe Lake and Lake Lucerne (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the naturally connected Pipe Lake and Lake Lucerne are the only hydrilla-infested lakes in the state of Washington?

elements.title: Dieux du Stade (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that sales from Dieux du Stade, a nude calendar produced by the French professional rugby union club Stade Français featuring photos of its players, helped to finance the club for many years?

elements.title: Carmen Scheibenbogen (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Carmen Scheibenbogen was awarded the German Cross of Merit for her work on ME/CFS at the suggestion of patients and relatives?

elements.title: statue of a renowned Dunedin clergyman (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that despite various proposals, a statue of a renowned Dunedin clergyman was not moved from its location adjacent to a brothel and two parking lots?
